result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Irizarry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 15 hours of community service per week.
No contact with R.W. or anyone under the age of 18.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  Comply with sex offender registry for 21 years. 

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment if deft qualifies.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 or if not, make good faith effort at obtaining fulltime status.

No contact with R.W.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18.

Sex Offender treatment/counseling/therapy as deemed appropriate.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry for 21 years.

Payment of any unpaid financial obligations.

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>10 yrs WI State Prison- 5 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES - CONDITIONS OF ES>> sex offender treatment/counseling/therapy as deemed appropriate; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 or if not, make good faith effort at obtaining fulltime status; no contact with R.W.; no contact with anyone under the age of 18; comply with Sex Offender Registry for 21 yrs; payment of any unpaid financial obligations. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 824 days jail credit. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP or SAP.

Case Called: 10:56 am 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Karl Schmidt.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to e-file 2nd amended information following court today. 
COURT grants. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Child Enticement)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 6 years probation - CONDITIONS: 6 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def qualifies; sex offender treatment; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 15 hours CS per week; no contact with R.W.; no contact with anyone under the age of 18; comply with Sex Offender Registry for 21 years; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 

COURT finds the def entitled to 552 days jail credit if revoked.

AMENDED.  $30,000.00 signature bond with first $15,000.00 in cash.  No contact with victim(s):  R.R.W. or anyone under the age of 18 unless supervised by 25 year old or older.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. NOTE: HEARING IS TO BE SET PRIOR TO DEFENDANT'S RELEASE IF ANOTHER INDIVIDUAL (besides deft) POSTS BOND TO ADDRESS THE POSTER RE: RESPONSIBILITY OF POSTING BOND.
